We forcibly tell it to fetch the remote value if the value we cached using a Guava cache has expired: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/3343/files#diff-90f8c925037a33f132339f9ada1e2e38R258
```java
SparkEnv.get().blockManager().getRemote(WATERMARKS_BLOCK_ID);
```
I'll go ahead and add the `batchInterval` to SparkRuntimeContext as suggested

I don't think you want to register tables with BeamSqlEnv within expand(). BeamSqlEnv is currently the global namespace.
As discussed above, there should be a BeamSqlEnv per query, to limit the scope of resisted tables. I would prefer to do it in another task, as it impacts both BeamSql and BeamSqlCli.
